title: What will be the value of set A union B minus A union C? - Quora

response.answer_text: (A U B): All elements of set - A or set - B (A U C): All elements of set - A or set - C Now, “(A U B) - (A U C)” means those elements which are part of set (A U B) but not part of set (A U C). Since, all elements of set - A are common to both (A U B) and (A U C); so, the difference between them are created by only those elements of set - B and set - C. Therefore, (A U B) - (A U C) = (B U C).

Answer: set B Let set A={1, 2,3}, set B={4,5,6}, set C={7, 8,9} NOW, AUB={1, 2,3,4,5,6} AUC={1, 2,3,7,8,9} AUB - AUC means subtract common elements from AUB of AUC Therefore, {1, 2,3,4,5,6}-{1, 2,3,7,8,9}={4, 5,6} Hence, set b is the value of set AUB-AUC
